rComments: Hands down the best and most revelatory class I have ever taken. It changed my life and opened up a universe that has continued to open yet new doors over the past 20 years. The guy is brilliant -- and maintains his humility anyway, somehow.

Very interesting but often a little unenthusiastic. Lots of guest lectures and films. No tests or finals, just papers. Papers are short, simple, and straightforward, but often require some outside research to supplement the material presented by the class. Grades papers generously. Very interesting to talk to at office hours.

this was probably the hardest I've ever had to work and think, but taking 126a and 126b with John was one of the most amazing things i've ever done. John is very different then any progessor i've had at UCSC, but he really cares about his students and the subject he is teaching. Down to earth, he is an increadible person! life changing opp.
This class blew, very unorganized, assigned a ridiculous amount of reading that was useless most of the time, spends the entire class rambling on tangents, on the other hand, he was very helpful

John is a really cool professor, all the haters might not dig his style, but if you are interested in the topic or willing to open your mind I think you'll enjoy the class. Very conceptual/theoretical teaching and he has some interesting ideas to share.
He asks you to work hard, but he is devoted to students like few professors are these days. He's a wonderful man.

John is an amazing professor! Seminar style, open discussions. No tests. Previous comments saying he is disorganized is you not taking responsibility for your education and asking for clarification. He is amazingly helpful and available and intimidatingly intelligent. If you have trouble thinking for youself then dont bother taking johns class.

Yes, John's lectures can ramble but that is not what makes John one of my favorite profs. He cares about his students in and out of class more than anyone else. He has a HUGE heart and will always be there to help you - though his approach is at times mysterious. His Watsonville Communities class changed my life's direction - it's hards-on, intimat

Borrego is ridiculously unorganized. His 'diagrams' make absolutely no sense. His lectures always run for an hour and forty five minutes straight. His is a horribly lecturer. He goes off on tangents, talks in only run on sentences and he makes it impossible to take notes. He gets very catty, very easily . Worst professor I've ever had.

Never really explains texts, and prepare to be frustrated by both the amount of books and reading he expects from you. TA's are a godsend in this class, Alicia is great, and really explains everything. I would say section is the most important (and it is 45% of your grade). Borrego lectures on economic systems, and doesn't connect to text.

This is the best class that I have ever taken.  Borego's hands-off teaching style was the most effective educational experience of my life.  if you have the chance to take the Watsonville Community and Global Capitalism courses with John, do not pass up this opportunity.  Be ready to work hard- its worth it!
